line_1: Devoted thus to politicks, and cards,
line_2: Nor mirth, nor wine, nor women he regards;

line_1: A snug and friendly game at cards;
Old lady Slipslop, at her morning cards,
line_2: Vows that all works of genus she regards;

line_1: As inoffensive, what offence in cards?
line_2: If he, the tinkling harpsichord regards

line_1: Bards may be Lords, but 'tis not in the cards,
line_2: Play how we will, to turn Lords into Bards.

line_1: Sir, you have pass'd, I now may shew my cards;
line_2: Six mattadores; four fish are my reward.

line_1: And tho' she plays no more, o'erlooks the Cards.
What now is spent in boxing and in cards:
line_2: 'Twas theirs t'incourage worth, and give to bards
